examples: They have a mad affair. He is besotted. But she is an expensive partner, and he needs money to keep her in style.
The husband … seems besotted with his wife and horribly jealous of the bird she's protecting.

definition: intoxicated or stupefied especially with drink
examples: … longed only to get out of the house for a lively evening with his old cronies, who were boorish, bumbling and besotted every last one of them.
We issued into an empty street through a half-open door, staggering like besotted revellers.
